dcterms:creator: Yann LeCun
LÃ©on Bottou
Yoshua Bengio
Patrick Haffner
dcterms:description: MNIST is often the first dataset for deep learning researchers to evaluate their work. The dataset contains 60,000 training samples and 10,000 testing samples, which are all 28x28 grayscale images of handwritten digits from 0 to 9.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:creator: Han Xiao
Kashif Rasul
Roland Vollgraf
dcterms:description: Fashion-MNIST consists of a training set of 60,000 images and a test set of 10,000 images from 10 clothing categories. Each sample is a grayscale image with a height and width of 28 pixels.
dcterms:title: Fashion-MNIST (FMNIST)

dcterms:creator: Johannes Stallkamp
Marc Schlipsing
Jan Salmen
Christian Igel
dcterms:description: GTSRB is a commonly-used benchmark in the literature of backdoor attack. It consists of 34,799 training instances and 12,630 testing instances of lifelike images. The task is to recognize 43 different traffic signs, which simulates an application scenario in automatic vehicle.
dcterms:title: German Traffic Sign Benchmark Dataset (GTSRB)

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
dcterms:description: CIFAR10 is a 32x32 color image dataset, including 50,000 training images and 10,000 testing images. It is evenly divided into 10 non-overlapping categories.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10
